item.title: Geospatial data
item.description: What is GIS? GIS stands for Geographic Information Systems (or Sciences), and refers to the software and techniques used to view, analyse, create, and modify geographic data. Weâ€™ll be borrowing some GIS terminology and techniques for this workshop. Traditional GIS software like ArcGIS Desktop and QGIS are desktop-based, but these exercises will focus on open source web-based tools. Common data types GIS data comes in two major types: raster and vector.
